title: Beyond the API: MCP and the Death of Integration Hell
abstract:
NET User Group for June: Beyond the API: MCP and the Death of Integration Hell with Calum Simpson

Integration hell is real, and developers have battled it for years. But with Model Context Protocol (MCP) gaining momentum, we‚Äôre finally seeing the light at the end of the tunnel.
In this talk, we‚Äôll take a step back to understand how we got here, where MCP fits into the modern dev toolkit, and why it‚Äôs more than just another protocol. You‚Äôll pick up practical insights for both devs and non-devs (Scrum Masters, I see you üëÄ), plus five fresh tips for thriving in the age of AI.

Then, buckle up for the main event: a proof of concept showing how MCP tools can power autonomous agents to tackle complex workflows - think Manus, but local; N8N, but agentic.
Whether you're building, planning, or just trying to keep up with it all, this session will challenge how you think about integration, and show why MCP might just be the missing piece.

Agenda:

6:00pm - Pizza and networking at SSW Sydney
6:30pm - The Tech news with Eve and Adam Cogan, followed by
MCP and the Death of Integration Hell with Calum Simpson

Can't make it? Join us on the live stream! üî¥
‚û°Ô∏è https://www.ssw.com.au/live
